moves.1. e4: This was played at a time control of 5 minutes and a 10 second increment. I thought this was a good example of a superior minor piece, particularly in the end.
moves.1... c5 2. f4 d5: Counterattacking in the center. Because of this move 2. Nc3 is more common.
moves.3... Bf5: Moving the bishop outside the pawn chain before playing e6.
moves.4. d3: Trying to blunt the bishop's diagonal. I think d4 is better because only one of white's bishops is bad while now both bishop's diagonals are blocked.
moves.4... e6: Preparing to develop the queen bishop.
moves.6. c3 Qb6: Increasing pressure on d4 and making it harder for white to develop his queenside bishop. Maybe d4 was better making it difficult for white to develop his pieces.
moves.7. Be2 Be7 8. Nbd2 O-O-O: Maybe 0-0 later would have been safer but white can't really get anything going on the queenside.
moves.13. a5 Kb7 14. axb6 axb6: White has opened up the a-file, however he has no penetration points.
moves.15. h3: Preventing Ng4 and perhaps preparing for a future g4.
moves.15... h4: Although this creates an outpost on g3 after Bf2 I would have to retreat my knight to a pathetic square. I think Bg6 and then h4 would be better.
moves.16. d4: Failing to take advantage of my weakness.
moves.16... c4 17. Nbd2 Bh7: ? The idea is good but Bg6 not restricting the rook would be superior.
moves.18. b3 cxb3: I didn't want the bfile to open.
moves.19. Nxb3 Nf5: Supporting h4, attacking e3 and threatening to jump onto g3.
moves.20... Rda8: Now that I have an advantage on the kingside I try to take control of the queenside too.
moves.21. O-O Ba3: Preparing for Bb2, Nxh4 Nxh4 Bxh4 doesn't win a pawn because of a discovered attack after Bc2.
moves.25. Be3 Be7: I didn't like the idea of  Ng5 and this further protects the h pawn.
moves.28. Rxa8 Kxa8: After these trades the remaining pieces become very important. Because of his bad bishop I have the advantage.
moves.34... Bd8: Bringing my bishop into the game by Ba5.
moves.35. Bd2: Stopping my plan however increase the power of my knight.
moves.37. Bc3 f6: I have to find a way to create another weakness.
moves.49. h4 Kb2 50. Na3 Kxa3 51. h5 Kb2: The a-pawn will queen so white resigns.
